qas.question: What is the major farming production crop in Burma?
What percentage of  the countries's farm-able land is used for the major farming production crop in Burma?
What category does the major farming production crop in Burma fall into ?
How is production in the category tallied ?
How many novel types of this crop did Burma develop as of 1997 ?

context: The major agricultural product is <a0_0>rice<a0_0/>, which covers about <a1_0>60%<a1_0/> of the country's total cultivated land area. Rice accounts for 97% of total <a2_0>food grain production<a2_0/> <a3_0>by weight<a3_0/>. Through collaboration with the International Rice Research Institute <a4_0>52 modern rice varieties<a4_0/> were released in the country between 1966 and 1997, helping increase national rice production to 14 million tons in 1987 and to 19 million tons in 1996. By 1988, modern varieties were planted on half of the country's ricelands, including 98 percent of the irrigated areas. In 2008 rice production was estimated at 50 million tons.
